list_definition.definition: a slanting edge (rather than a sharp corner)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: A chisel has a bevel on its cutting edge.

list_ex_of_english: Except for fishscale shingles above the window level, bevelled siding is used throughout.
To prevent cracking and loss of surface carbon, quenching is usually performed before beveling, shaping, and sharpening the edge.
In the millions of years since these mountains were uplifted and folded erosion has beveled them into a nearly flat plain.
The lower par t of the remaining corpus was then beveled on the exterior, completely removing the mental eminence.
Certain parts were beveled or chamfered to prevent cutting soldiers' hands and arms.
Osteotomes are similar to a chisel but bevelled on both sides.
When the heads have been prepared with bevels in top and underside to engage with the cask grooves they were put in the casks.
Both the adult rooms downstairs and the children's rooms upstairs have fireplaces with galzed brick, marbleized tile floors, carved mantels and beveled mirrors.
